newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Jordan's King Hussein to visit Arafat in Gaza.
newsitem.headline: Jordan's King Hussein to visit Arafat in Gaza.

text.p: King Hussein of Jordan plans on Sunday to make his first trip to Gaza since Israel seized it from Egypt in the 1967 Middl East War and he will meet Palestinian President Yasser Arafat there, a senior Palestine Liberation Organisation official said on Saturday night.
"President Arafat will receive King Hussein in Gaza tomorrow to hold important talks on the peace process," Arafat adviser Nabil Abu Rdainah told Reuters.
"His visit is part of the Egyptian-Jordanian-Palestinian consulation on the peace process," he added.
The visit would also be only the second visit by the Jordanian monarch to Palestinian self-rule areas. Jordanian Prime Minister Abdul Karim al-Kabariti was due to accompany King Hussein to Gaza.
Arafat held talks with Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak in Cairo on Saturday.
The Palestinian Authority said on Saturday U.S.-mediated talks between on a long-overdue Israeli troop redeployment in the West Bank town of Hebron were in crisis and near a dead-end.
